title: Roastery Coffee House
address: 8 2, 418, 287/12, Road No. 14, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034, India
description: Charming cafe with garden seating. Light fare, treats & specialty coffees are offered in a quaint cafe with a garden patio.

reviews_content.text: This is a great place for people looking to have a well rounded meal along with a cup of hot speciality coffee. The food was great and the service was excellent.nThe restaurant had great attention to detail. They had water spray for the outdoor seating to ensure the heat does not cause the people who opt for it to have a less than ideal experience.nThey had a good spread both on the menu and also with respect to the speciality coffees. I would recommend this as a must visit place if you are in and around Banjara hills.

I really love your café. Everything is just perfect—especially your coffee, which I truly believe is the best in town. All your staff members are incredibly courteous and well-informed about the menu. What impressed me most is how well they understand the preferences and needs of the customers.nnAs a pet parent, I was especially touched by how warmly my dog was welcomed. The complimentary dog food is a wonderful idea, and the way your staff treats her—with the same care and attention as any guest—is heartwarming. I couldn’t be happier. Thank you for creating such a thoughtful and inclusive space.

The cranberry coffee just blew my mind. I absolutely loved it and the taste lingers in the mouth long after you’ve had it. We also had the chicken peri peri flat bread pizza and burnt cheese cake with chocolate sauce. Everything was top quality, fresh and delicious. And what made our dining experience better was the pleasant service by Ms. Fiza. She takes care of every customer like her own guest and is mindful of their requirements. Ms. Fiza makes dining at Roastery a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

The ambience was really simple inside. Didn't like the plain walls. Service was good and food came out quick. Tried the Spinach Corn sandwich and BBQ chicken burger. Both of the portions were very good and the filling was generous.

Atmosphere is the best part of this place. Very chill, and especially at night the lights and plants are so pretty outside. We just came for coffee and dessert. The coffee was alright. If you’re into the more snooty, high end coffee it’s probably great. For me a little overdone, but I do like the way they serve it in different glasses. For dessert we tried carrot cake and the burnt cheesecake. The carrot cake was not carrot cake. It was still good though. It’s just not proper carrot cake. The cheesecake was quite different. It actually tasted more like the Mexican sweet flan, but it was good. The service is very slow, but that’s understandable as they are very busy. Overall a nice place to chill.

Decent prices, great place for couples and even families of that matter. Both indoor and outdoor seating are available and if you want to sit outdoors, i would recommend either morning time or past 4pm in the evening.nnAlthough for outdoor seating there's water sprinkles that dispense a spray of water to keep the place cool. It's basically tiny droplets

Good food.nnWhite sauce pasta was amazing.nCoffee is very good as well.nnI just feel this place is way too expensive. I understand it's on a premium location so the markup is expected, but can be reduced a bit.

Roastery is an easy recommendation be it for someone who likes coffee or someone who just likes to experience good food in a cosy place with a lovely ambience.nnJust be aware that it's almost always crowded here and you may have to wait a little depending on what time of the day you decide to visit.nnThe few times I visited the service was really good and timely, everything that i ordered was yummy and totally worth it.

I suppose there is always rush in the evenings. I visited on a Friday evening and there was a wait time. There is no music on the premises, and services were rather delayed. I ordered red pasta and requested penne, but he brought me spaghetti. However, when I requested, he replaced it. The taste was not to my satisfaction, but I also got a cappuccino, which was wonderful. Overall, this was not my preferred option because the crowd was too loud and there was no relaxing music to help me relax. Perhaps I went at the incorrect time.
Beautiful ambience both indoors and outdoors. Indoors can be noisy, but the outdoor seating is quieter. The food is average—nothing special, but decent. A great spot to relax, especially outside.

A must visit for food lovers and ambiance seekers !!nThe food was absolutely delicious, with each dish perfectly seasoned and beautifully presentednWhat really set this restaurant apart, though, was the ambiance. The interior was thoughtfully designed with a perfect blend of modern elegance and cozy charm. Soft lighting, comfortable seating, and tasteful decor created a warm and inviting atmosphere that made the meal even more enjoyable. Whether you're looking for a casual dinner or a special evening out, this place has the perfect vibe.
Good food. Good coffee. Wonderful atmosphere. Loved the green outdoor setting. The misting kept the place cool even in the scorching Hyderabad summer.

Review for Roastery Coffee Housenn⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️☆ (4/5)nnRoastery Coffee House was a lovely experience. The setting is beautiful, especially the outdoor area, which adds to the charm. We had breakfast—the omelettes were lovely, and the granola bowl was delicious.nnThe staff was attentive and went out of their way to make us comfortable, which was a big plus. However, it would have been nice if they had a designated smoking section, as that would have made me more likely to return.nnCoffee-wise, the cappuccino was good, but the pour-over was just ordinary. That said, the ambiance, set in an old house with multiple levels, makes it a great place to visit. Worth checking out!
I loved their unique take on Cranberry Coffee, and it was a highlight of my visit.! The cafe's menu offered a variety of tasty options, catering to different tastes.!!

We tried their sweet nitro cold brew, zucchini fries and chocolate cheese cake. The sweet nitro cold brew is good.. not better than their cranberry cold coffee.. but it is good.nThe zucchini fries were good as well... The quantity is satisfactory. The chocolate cheese cake was not at all worth the price.nnThe service was so slow and we've been given wrong orders twice.nThe ambience is top notch.. very pretty.

The cafe was good in general but nothing was amazing or overwhelming!nnTheir service was great, we got our food on time! The ambiance was good too, however the outdoor seating can go for a toss if it starts raining! They could have a retractable roof of sorts for the outdoor seating area to avoid this.nnThe coffess were average (We ordered 2) at best buy why I still gave food a solid 4 rating is because the pasta was amazing!nnWhat Seemed Missing?nI would like to have more options in their coffee menu. As someone who loves a plane and simple iced coffee with no sugar, I left the place wanting more.nnPlus they have valet parking service too, which is a definite plus majorly because the locality can be at times confusing and doesn't have a lot of parking space available.

Cafe from the heavens. The quality of coffee and food was on another level for me. Beyond the impeccable dishes and coffe, The ambience here takes the cake. The place is super busy though and sometimes you might have to wait to get service but one can see why.
Highly rated and definitely recommended. Must visit. In the middle of a lane. Not in any big market or mall. Comfy place. Good variety. Everything is so fresh.
One of the best Cafe’s with great ambience. Food has been top class. Been here multiple times and it has never disappointed me. Bread has been so fresh that it will make you eat more.

I remember visiting this place 2 years ago and it was equally beautiful as it was when i visited two weeks ago i usually come down to Hyderabad from goa and to see that a place is still maintaining their quality of food and drinks with their ambiance and aesthetics is just mind blowing to me im truly happy that such places still exist where i can reliably go to and wont get disappointed over the quality of food or service whatsoever, will definitely be back here soon and would love to recommend and tell everyone i know about this place.
Amazing amazing , My fav is their signature cranberry coffee,  white sauce pasta, their hot chocolate, which is also a must try. Very decent place to go chill with friends. ♥️

This place is a chill spot for a coffee fix, with some unique options on the menu! Tried the Cranberry Coffee - a Roastery invention & a trademark creation, Americano, and Nutella Blend – all were great, but the Cranberry Coffee really stood out. The food didn’t disappoint either; the Cheese Balls and Potato Cutlet Sandwich were awesome. The whole vibe is super aesthetic, and they’ve got some great coffee beans to choose from. I even snagged a pouch of beans ground to my pour-over preference. Definitely worth a visit!

It's a decent cafe ..staff was very friendly ...we tried the cranberry coffe ...guys if you order the cold brew please let it settle down for good 15mins ..then you will feel the taste .. and trust me they serve mouth watering pasta ...all pasta were good...fully satisfied

Sadly there standards of food and hygiene have gone down from before .. They cannot manage the crowd and we were sitting right in front of the ordering desk and repeatedly people were sending food back .. I hope they improve and it’s as good as it was earlier..

Been here on a festival and it has got a very good vibe. We had waited for nearly 50 mins to get a table. Service from the staff was great. Coming to the food we have tried:nMushroom and Cheese Bruschetta and it was awesome.nPeri Peri chicken pizza was decent.nWe had Chicken Kheema Lasagna and it was disappointing. The chicken kheema was so hard and everyone who has tried this at our table had our stomach upset the next day. Rest of all the food items were good.
Amazing place with great ambiance. We love their Vietnamese coffee, Iced Americano and Veg Club Sandwich the most.
A very elegant cafe with a cozy ambience just designed inside a bungalow. Fast and good service, coffee is good, food is also decent.

The atmosphere and setting of the coffee house has been wonderfully done.nLoved the light decor on the trees and walk way.nI had the burnt cheese cake with milk mocha(diary version), along with fish and chips.nWould recommend the same, I also loved the  diary free option(oats milk) that was on the menu.nPleased and highly appreciative of the service provided, they are readily available and provide good suggestions. The service was the highlight for me.nThank you!

title: Conçu Jubilee Hills
address: Plot No 738, Rd Number 37, CBI Colony, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India
description: Bright, simply appointed European bakery. Sunny European patisserie with modest decor, wooden tables & cakes & pastries in a glass display.

reviews_content.text: Be it taste, ambience and presentation, Concu comes with the best in all three.From the humble staff to the aesthetic vibes, this place is perfect for an evening hangout with your friends.We tried the Pasta - Fettuccini Pesto Genovese and the Mushroom Cheese Brioche Sandwich, both of which were flavorful and well-prepared. The Cold Coffee was perfectly balanced, and the Basil Mango Kombucha added a refreshing twist to the meal.Staff members were so sweet and cooperative. Had one of the most delicious cakes.

Conçu in Jubilee Hills is pure bliss for dessert lovers and café enthusiasts. The pastries and cakes are absolutely divine—especially the signature Tres Leches and macarons. Every item looks like a piece of art and tastes just as amazing. The ambiance is serene, elegant, and perfect for everything from a quiet coffee to a casual meeting. Their coffee is top-notch, and the savory options are equally impressive. The service is warm and professional, making the entire experience delightful. A must-visit for anyone who appreciates fine desserts and classy café vibes.

Visited Conçu in Jubilee Hills and had a delightful experience! The almond croissant was perfectly flaky and rich in flavor — flavorful, buttery, and well-balanced. The ambiance was cozy and elegant, making it a great spot for a relaxed brunch or coffee catch-up. Definitely coming back to try more from their menu!
White pasta was good (Non-veg)nTried Pizza (Veg) it is averagenBurger 🤦🏻‍♂️❌nMust try - DesertsnTiramisunMango and trifle

Wanted to take my GenZ sister to a “Gucci” place in HYD. Both of us loved the place and the vibe. Cold coffee was so good.  We visited again during our week long trip. Saw that this cafe is even there at the airport.

Loved this place, it’s quite an asthetic cafe with good food and service. The desserts are quite nice, i loved the Noir chocolate Eclair and strawberry Tresleches, in savoury i tried Jerk Chicken, it was tasty as well! Also do not forget to try the white chocolate coffee, super yum!!🤤

I recently had the chance to visit Conch Jubilee Hills, and it’s a hidden gem! Nestled in a cozy spot with minimalistic interiors, it has a soft, inviting vibe that I loved. The desserts were the highlight—especially the cookie croissant, which was my absolute favorite, along with some delicious macarons. While the drinks were just okay, the desserts definitely made up for it.nnIt’s a great spot to visit in the evening for snacks with friends. The washrooms were clean, and the menu clearly marks vegetarian options, making it easy for everyone. If you’re a dessert lover, this is definitely a place to try! ✨💙
I got the most amazing hot chocolate here. The avocado toast was also brilliant. Desserts dont have much eggless options.nAmbience is good, staff is cordial.

Absolutely amazing place! Aesthetically pleasing cozy cafe for best Italian food.nnIf you're looking for something best in Italian concu is a must visit cafe.nnTheir food is just delicious. Pasta is oh so flavorsome. So is Pizza and cappuccino coffee.nnMust try:nFettuccini Pesto GenovesenOrtolana PizzannFood - 5/5nAmbience - 5/5nService - 5/5

Just a treat which I deserved for a long time. Finally I’ve arrived at the real place which will hold a special place in my heart when it comes to a cafe, dessert or cheesecake place. Thanks for existing concu, you guys make magic out there.

Hands down, one of the best Tiramisu we've had. It was so tasty, and the texture was perfect. The rum liquor squeeze tube was an excellent touch and it enhanced the experience immensely.nnAnyone visiting Hyd should try their best to come here and try the Tiramisu.

We stopped to pick up some desserts ,they have a wide choice. We picked up some chocolate eclairs,honey cake ,creme brulee and choux pastry. Each was delicious 🤤. The service is very good too. Always a pleasure to visit it. They have a seating area indoors and outdoors too.

The more I say, the less it is for this place. In my opinion, I've had the best desserts of my life here at Concu, and I'm dead serious.nnThe food, the service, the atmosphere, everything is perfect. And my oh my the food, *chef's kiss*.nnWe ordered multiple things from the menu over the course of 2 days and there wasn't one thing that disappointed. They've absolutely nailed the flavors and portions of almost all the recipes.nnI wish there were more outlets all over the country, because i would do anything for another bite of that French toast, man. Simply the best.nnYou can try the desserts as per your palette, but, in my opinion, you should definitely try the Strawberry Basil tres leches. Out. Of. This. World.nnThe coffee is amazing as well. And as I've said a hundred times above, They, do not miss.nnKudos to the whole team. 🙌🏻
Bill no 806551 at Jubilee hills outlet. Ordered Mellow Mauve smoothie..completely tasteless and bland. Waiter did not even care to make it right and walked away. Poor customer service
Very good desserts, the Banoffe is my favourite! Delicious layers of crumble and cream with bananas. The honey cake is also very delicious. A must try!

This is a fantastic spot to satisfy your dessert cravings, offering a wide variety of options. Their tiramisu is the best in the area. The ambience is great, making it a perfect place to enjoy a sweet treat.
Visited this cozy French-themed café for brunch. The food was delicious & loved the ambience. Bon appétit! 🥐
Everything is decent - but the rates are over the top for the quality of food. So if you want a good atmosphere but overpriced desserts and coffee, go for it. Servers are really helpful and kind.

This cafe is renowned for its delectable pastries and cakes, but don't overlook their savory options.nI indulged in their Fettuccini red sauce pasta, bursting with flavorful richness.nThe Veg burger surpassed expectations with its crispy patty and soft bun, a true delight.nEven the simple pleasure of onion rings was elevated here. Dessert stole the show with a blueberry cheesecake that's simply irresistible, and a tiramisu that's equally divine.nWithout a doubt, this cafe comes highly recommended for a culinary experience that satisfies every craving.

This place is welcoming with its beautiful setting. They have a carefully designed menu, and I loved their Ortolana pizza and Veg Napolitana pasta with a cup of great coffee! The food was very balanced in taste. The best part is that their staff was friendly and attentive. It’s also a great place for kids, which is a big plus for families. It’s a fantastic spot for delicious food and a wonderful atmosphere. Can’t wait to go back!

Conçu Hyderabad is a great spot if you’re craving desserts and looking for a cozy café atmosphere, but there are a few areas that could use some improvement.nnAmbience & Vibe: The café has a lovely and warm aesthetic. The décor is tasteful, and it’s a comfortable place to unwind, whether you’re meeting up with friends or spending some quiet time alone. The outdoor seating is pleasant, especially in the evenings, but the indoor space can feel a bit cramped, especially during peak hours. Finding a spot to sit on weekends can be challenging, and it does get noisy, which takes away from the relaxed vibe.nnDesserts: The desserts are definitely the highlight here. Conçu has a variety of beautifully crafted pastries, cakes, and tarts, and the quality is consistently good. My personal favorites are the Hazelnut Tart and the Pistachio Éclair, both of which are rich and flavorful. However, while the desserts look gorgeous, I’ve found that some of them can be overly sweet, especially the macarons. A little more balance in the sweetness would make them more enjoyable. Also, the price point feels a bit on the higher side for what you get.nnFood Menu: Their savory offerings are decent but nothing extraordinary. The sandwiches and croissants are fresh, but I feel like the options are limited and the taste is fairly standard compared to other cafes in the city. I had the Avocado Toast once, and while it was good, it wasn’t something I’d go out of my way to order again. For a place that shines with desserts, the savory menu could use a bit more variety and flavor.nnCoffee & Drinks: Conçu’s coffee is solid, though not exceptional. I’ve had their cappuccino a few times, and while it’s good, it lacks the depth of flavor that you’d expect from a café known for its drinks. Their iced coffees are refreshing, especially the Iced Caramel Coffee, but again, nothing stood out as particularly memorable. If you're a casual coffee drinker, you'll probably enjoy it, but for coffee aficionados, it might not hit the mark.nnService: The service is where Conçu could really improve. The staff are friendly, but during busy hours, it can take quite a while for orders to arrive. On a couple of occasions, I found the wait times for both food and drinks to be longer than expected, and there have been times where my order wasn’t quite right. They are polite and fix things quickly, but the consistency could be better.nnConclusion: Overall, Conçu is a nice café with some standout desserts and a charming atmosphere, but there are a few areas that need refining, especially when it comes to service and pricing. It’s a good place to visit if you’re in the mood for something sweet, but with the growing café culture in Hyderabad, there are several other places that might offer a more well-rounded experience. A solid 4 stars from me!
soo I order buttermilk chicken it was good affogato was okay okay strawberry cream was tasty prefect balance of sweetness good ambience…

One of the most premium cafes I've ever visited. We visited on a weekend night. The cafe looked so beautiful with all the lighting and greenery outside. It was packed with people and was very lively. They have outdoor and indoor seating. The inside of the cafe is pleasant with pastel color themes and neat, minimalistic layout.nnThe desserts here are sure to tempt you. The cookies, pastries, eclairs, mousses all look really well done. The prices are a bit on the higher side, but it is one of the rare times when you feel the food is worth it. The bakery items and desserts are definitely good. Other food items are pretty good too, but didn't find them to be that different from other cafes. Would definitely recommend to people who like bakeries and desserts. Wanna try the chocolate pastries next time!

Conçu - The Patisserie Paradise:nnHyderabad’s Sweetheart: Arguably the city’s most famous patisserie, Conçu is a must-visit for dessert aficionados.nExquisite Delights: Prepare to be wowed by beautiful and delicious pastries and cakes.nLuxury Setting: Jubilee Hills provides a premium backdrop to your decadent indulgence.nPricey Pleasure: Be prepared to shell out some extra bucks for their top-notch offerings.

Want to experience true food orgasm try the desserts here……. Oh my god what desserts fantastic. The emotion that you have after taking first bite of each of the desert is something you need to experience. Some days it’s expensive I would say it’s priceless.nI had gone just to have desserts and it was mind blowing. Staff here is very friendly. Very polite. Helpful and happy to serve.nThey have ample of parking. Have in door and kind of outdoor sitting. Ambience is too good and I would jump on opportunity just to come back here.nI pray I get this joint in my city.

I'm a big fan of their desserts. 🫰💚🍰nI tried almost all of em.. seasonal & regular. They are just *chef's kiss*nnThe French biscuit birthday cake is the best birthday cake that I've ever eaten. 🖤🤍nnUpdate :nI had my first tiramisu here. It has alcohol in it. If u r not underage. It's a must try. Do not miss out on it. It adds a very good kick to it.nThe mango tart is average. Nothing special about it.

Ambience, food and service, all were spot on. Food was great. We ordered Croissants, Cold beverages, Mushroom Sandwich, Pasta and deserts. The presentation and quality was excellent. It's a must visit if you're in Hyderabad.nThere is plenty parking space.nnVisited on 01.02.2024nReviewed on 02.02.2024
Dropped by Conçu’s Jubilee Hills outlet today and had a great time! The cozy ambiance and their amazing desserts never disappoint. Perfect place to relax and indulge!

title: Motown Stories Cafe
address: C8CQ+VF2, Kapil Towers, Opposite to ICICI Bank Nanakram Guda, ISB Rd, Financial District, Gachibowli, Hyderabad, Telangana 500008, India
description: Hip driving-themed spot for cafe fare. Snacks & drinks offered in a rugged driving-themed cafe with graffiti & quirky curios.

reviews_content.text: The first thing that attracts you here is a wide variety of top notch bikes, cars And yes, you could actually drive them by renting them out.This place is photogenic and has amazing biking vibes.The best thing which makes it different from other theme based cafes is the taste of food they maintain.The whole place has that Iron smell since all beams and roofs are made of metal. There are high chairs kept. It has two seating areas. One on the ground and another on the first floor.Also regarding the price point, I feel that the quality is too great to worry about the price.Best of all, this cafe stays open even after midnight. Great music with great food and coffee.
Incredible experience esp for car/bike enthusiasts- motown theme and the in-cafe vibe was just on point! They have a line-up of Harley, Porsche, Benz etc- feast to the eyes and otherwise food decent.

Stepping into Motown feels like entering a mini museum dedicated to quirky roadside adventures.nnI ordered a chocolate croissant, an iced latte, and a hot cappuccino. The chocolate croissant was divine—crispy on the outside with just the right amount of gooey chocolate inside. The iced latte was perfectly balanced, not too sweet, with a smooth, robust coffee flavor. The hot cappuccino was a comforting classic, with creamy froth and a rich espresso base that warmed me up instantly.nnIt’s a must-visit for coffee lovers and anyone seeking a unique hangout spot.
Wow what range of coffee. Should try mushroom coffee. The food is veg and are very good. Korean buns were good. Desert tiramisu was good. Must visit for coffee lovers.

A Must visit place for a motor enthusiast as the cafe's decor is something beautiful to adore.nStill my go to midnight cafe especially during cold winters, I come and try the espresso pods with milk every-time because they have endless varieties of it. My favourite being the Hazelnut and Caramel Coffee till now.nThey also display amazing supercars and super-bikes which are available for rental services.
This is my favorite cafe. I hang out with my friend here every month on weekends, and I love the coffee, especially the affogato. The service is always excellent. I really appreciate it.

The atmosphere here is really good.nIf you are a guy interested in cars bikes would like nice pics and enquire about rentals- go here.nIf you are looking for good coffee - skip this place.nnThe food is below average.nI ordered a blueberry muffin, Irish coffee and cafe caramel.nNow both the coffees looked the same and had the same average taste.nnI didn't like the fact that there is no QR code menu scanning at the tables.nStaff has a very non welcoming attitude and definitely not interested to give you quality coffee.
Definitely very unique ambiance! But the food falls short of what one would hope for. The pepper mushroom soup was so subtle that i thought it was just hot water with some lemon.

Had a cup of coffee and croissant at this place. Taste was Ok. This place is photogenic and has amazing biking vibes. Crowd was awesome and we enjoyed our visit. Main attraction is the set up here. Recommended for evening coffee treat.

This cafe is beautifully decorated with antique bikes and car, you will get a vintage vibe with variety of coffee options. I really like the ambience and snacks as well. Must try chilly cheese toast, chocolate croissant 🥐.

Different ambiencenExotic cars and garage based interiorsnThe best thing which makes it different from other theme based cafes is the taste of food they maintain.nAffordable and economical pricingnHazelnut frappe 5/5nBlueberry thickshake 5/5nChilli Garlic Bread 4/5nVeg Exotic Pizza 4.5/5

It is an excellent Retro Club styled cafe. All the decor with a simple and garage-based theme gives it a unique look on the whole. When it comes to the vibe, music, atmosphere, and self-service make the cafe too good to stay and chill with friends for a longer time than usual. Food and Beverages are the best at this place since everything is served all fresh and clean. Brownies taste really great and are a perfect combo to order with any hot beverage. All the other desserts like Cake slices, Pies, Cheesecake, and Muffins are available along with many savory items such as Sandwiches, Burgers, and Pizzas. This place is a must visit cafe in Hyderabad.

It's a great place for automobile enthusiasts. The place has a lively vibe to it theri array of different types of coffees and teas with an assortment of snacks to go along with your beverage is great. I find myself most of the weekends chilling over at Driven Cafe with my buddies. The interior has a rustic steam punk look to it. The service is quick even though it's a self serve arrangement.

Nice Ambience. Love the superbikes kept inside. Food is just on par with Starbucks. The whole place has that Iron smell since all beams and roofs are made of metal. There are high chairs kept. It has two seating areas. One on the ground and another on the first floor. Do visit for some fun times.

I am so much in love with this cafe. 😍nAfter a long time I have wanted to drink coffee regularly. They serve the best coffee in the neighborhood, also the best ambience for bike lovers. You can even rent bikes from here. And let me tell you the bikes are great.nAlso regarding the price point, I feel that the quality is too great to worry about the price.nBest of all, this cafe stays open even after midnight. Great music with great food and coffee.nnI visit every Saturday. Trust me normally I will get bored of going someplace so frequently but this place is too amazing.

The first thing that attracts you here is a wide variety of top notch bikes, cars And yes, you could actually drive them by renting them out. The theme of the cafe is so vibrant and lifting spirits that you wouldn't mind to while away time and chat away to glory with your gang. A good variety of Tea & Coffee is served. Prices are not too high unlike similar themed Cafes. Overall a cool experience with a will to definitely wanna go again.

First of all this is the worst cafe in this area..please don't waste your time money and mood..I will just not recommend it..nn1. Food is just bad..this is my worst experience about food in any cafe..I couldn't understand why people are recommending this cafe..and it's a veg cafe😳...I should give minus rating to them but there is no option at all..nWe ordered:n✓Cheese chilli toast (0/5)n✓Paneer tikka sandwich (0/5)n✓Coffee mocha (1/5)n✓Cappuccino (1/5)n✓ Tripple chocolate cake (0/5)nI won't recommend to waste your money on their food..plating is also badnn2. Service is too poor..they are not cleaning tables at all..they don't have pepper powder to sprinkle also..they are just bad..they have given automatic token dispenser to customer but it was ringing after the food we have took from them..so so bad experience..nn3.we didn't't like the ambience also..if u want to sit outside that is also a bad decision..so don't go.. Highly not recommend 👎💀
The aesthetic is really one of a kind.nWe tried mocha latte and capachino. Mocha latte is good.nThe service was fast.

Awesome cafe. Worth visiting. The best thing about the place is the taste of coffee they serve. Any sort of coffee you choose, they will provide you the best taste they can. Another good thing is that the cafe is open 24*7, so you can visit the place any time. The quantity of the coffee provided is more than enough. Personally, i am never able to finish even the regular coffee. The snacks provided are good for short bites.  Have been to this  place several times and  will surely recommend it. The ambience  of the place is strongly built on bike and car theme. You can even hire expensive cars & bikes from this place. Must visit for quick bites.

This place resembles same like workshop.I enjoyed it, everything is expensive but if you are looking to watch sports bikes and cars you can find it here. They have various cars from different companies and I found bikes too like Ducati etc. Overall experience was good how ever we could only had a coffee there ambiance is so perfectly build like they have various mechanics tools.

Amazing place, lot of cool rides to look and pick from. The seating is very modernist. Make no mistake, it IS a biker’s cafe. It screams like one and does well.nnI had the coffee and it was good, and served hot.. unlike those yippie joints where it’s lukewarm. The way it should be. Staff is warm and friendly.nnThere are plenty of bakery options to choose from, both vegetarian and non-vegetarian. The prices are also fairly reasonable.nnParking is tricky as you may need to park in basement. I was lucky to get slot outside.nnMust visit if you like bikes, fast cars. A few cycles are kept on display too but I am a cyclist myself and they were ok sort.nnIt certainly is a unique experience and must visit spot.

A cafe for bike and car enthusiasts. The cafe is based on a garage like theme with high end cycles and bikes placed inside it. You can also rent racing bikes here at a per hour cost. Regarding the drinks, I would say it's perfect. A must visit cafe for sports bikes and car enthusiasts.

Have always heard about Driven Cafe a lot but didn’t liked it on person. Mught the quality has been decreased.nnDidn’t find the snacks worthy of price. Ordered chilli chesse toast - wasn’t fresh, not ovened properly. Presentation was more like a local shop.nEven after asking coffee in non disposable cups we were served in paper cups. One coffee had a hair strand and we had to ask them a lot to change it.nStaff is non cooperative.nnEven the vibe was not upto the status.nnI would suggest Driven Cafe to maintain and work on the food and ambience quality and hygiene.
located inside Kapil tower has enough parking space. This rustic themed cafe is styled like garages...nOrdered paneer sandwich, palak corn sandwich, cold coffee n banana walnut cake.

I like the place .. place is Pretty cool . If you are biker or you like bikes don’t don’t have like me then you should come here and click with bike 😅😅😍 i to love this concept… you definitely hang out here .. it’s very cool dude type place .. I came alone 🥲. If you have company you can come with them and enjoy the coffee and  menu 😊

A quirky retro cafe with quirky wall art, murals, and bikes. It is a bit sad that they had to shut off the first floor for business. Also, a little effort for the upkeep of the place can be shown as the cafe has the potential to attract more crowd. The food that we ordered was amazing especially the banana muffin and the cold coffees. Hope it continues to remain charming and artsy.

Good place to hangout with friends during office hours. Great ambience and good drinks(coffee and shakes ) available here.nThe bikes and cars displayed outside the cafe and also the posters and the design is a visual treat.

One of the best places in the city that I know of.nnI would highly recommend trying the dessert brownie ( please do ask them to heat it for longer time) and then dive in right at it.nnIve been here on multiple occassions, and tried the followingnn1 dessert brownie - bestn2 raspberry lemonade- I like raspberry and liked it as welln3 cinnamon roll- was alrightn4 peanut butter brownie ( worth it for PB lovers)nnHead over, give this place it's due love

title: Cafe Niloufer
address: C/B, V.P 11-5-422, Red Hills Rd, Red Hills, Lakdikapul, Hyderabad, Telangana 500004, India
description: Casual bakery cafe for tea & biscuits. Freshly baked Osmania biscuits, malai bun & Irani chai draw a crowd to this low-key cafe.

reviews_content.text: I have recently visited this place, here is my honest review about this place -nFor more visit my Instagram Page- @mandar.ayachitnn1. Ambiance - this place has a good ambiance, 2 floor cafe where 1st floor has sitting arrangements for family and friends. Which has really good vibe. Ground floor has cafe, stores, shopping centre.nn2. Service- this place was crowded, there will be some waiting period to get place, but personally I didn’t like the service, it was way slow and kind of rude. We have asked for a glass of water but the service boy was some rude and directly told it will take time to get water. Which was not at all good behaviour.nn3. Food - Tea was really a good in taste and enough quantity. As compared to price this was ok. One time visit for me. Bun Maska was really good. Bun was really fresh and tasty.nn4. Parking - enough parking space is available.

If you’re looking for a late-night tea fix, Niloufer Chai is the place to be. Even at 12:30 midnight, the place is buzzing with a huge crowd, which says a lot about its popularity. Be prepared to wait—both at the cash counter and the tea counter—but the wait is worth it.nnThe chai itself is incredibly fresh and refreshing, living up to the hype. The strong, bold flavors make it perfect for those who enjoy a robust tea experience.nnThe ambiance might be a bit chaotic due to the crowd, but if you’re into the energetic, street-side tea culture, you’ll love it. Definitely a go-to spot for a late-night tea craving!

☕ What Makes It Stand OutnThe Niloufer tea (kadak chai) is said to be “perfectly balanced” and renowned for pairing with butter-laden snacks like Osmania biscuits, bun maska, and malai buns  .**Strong nostalgia factor:**n“It’s my favourite spot… chai make you more joyful undoubtedly.”nWide outlet presence:**nMultiple locations—Red Hills/Lakdikapul, Banjara Hills, Himayatnagar, Airport, Hi‑Tec City—each with slightly varied menus and vibes  .nValue offerings for families and groups:**nVariety of teas, biscuits (especially Osmania), puffs, buns, and even rice bowls; suitable for breakfast, brunch, or casual meetups.

I regularly visit Cafe Niloufer, and it has become one of my favorite spots for a good cup of tea. The tea here is truly amazing—strong, flavorful, and served piping hot, just the way it should be. What makes the experience even better is pairing the tea with their Osmania biscuits. The combination is a classic and offers the perfect balance of flavors, making every visit satisfying and comforting.nnThe atmosphere at Cafe Niloufer is always lively, yet there's a sense of warmth and familiarity that keeps me coming back. Whether you're catching up with friends or just taking a break, it's a great place to relax and enjoy a quick snack. I would definitely recommend others to visit this place, especially tea lovers looking for that perfect blend and a nostalgic taste of Hyderabad.

I visited the Lakdikapul branch and tried tea, malai bun, and chole bhature—everything tasted great, especially the tea!!nnIf you’re visiting with family or friends, I highly recommend sitting on the second floor for a better experience. The ground floor atmosphere isn’t as pleasant. Overall, a great place for a tea break!🍒

One of the Best & famous restaurants in Hyderabad for Tea, snacks & quick bites.nIt opens till late night.nEverytime it remains crowded.nDifferent types of tea & snacks are available here.nDigital couple screen & self service.nA must visit place to enjoy tea & snacks.
For 2 we have taken 2 full tea and 1 bun Maska, tea ☕️ is good as expected! Different from regular Hyderabadi/Irani chai so called. For one tea 70/- little expensive for the regular chai lovers

Visited this place many times.nThis place is known for their chai.nChai with osmania biscuits are a must try.nApart from this,nFruit bun, sandwich, muffins are good.nplace is very busy.ncar parking would be difficult.

One of the oldest cafes of Hyderabad. It became so popular that they have opened many branches. This branch is classic. From the outside, you won't find anything, but inside it is very spacious. The owners might have made some changes from outside for the passerby to attract. The items are very good, but at a premium.
Had one of the best tea in Hyderabad.nnHighly recommended.nnThe bun maska is so juicy and melts in mouth.

Cafe Niloufer lived up to its reputation as one of Hyderabad's iconic spots. I discovered it through YouTube, where it received glowing reviews, so I had to visit during my trip. Despite the crowd, the service was impressively quick, showcasing their efficiency.nnI tried the Osmania Biscuit, Niloufer Tea Single, and Maska Bun. The Maska Bun stole the show—perfectly buttery and indulgent. Even though I’m not a tea lover, I genuinely enjoyed their tea, which complemented the biscuits wonderfully.nnThe lively atmosphere added to the charm, making it a memorable experience to enjoy such simple yet delicious food amidst a bustling crowd. Cafe Niloufer is a must-visit for anyone exploring Hyderabad!

The cafe was extremely popular and overflowing with people even around midnight. We waited for a few mins for a table. The bun maska was to die for. So soft and sweet, Absolutely loved it. Tried the special chai, a nice combo with the bun. The pancake was okay okay.
Great overall experience but little concern on budget.  But we can experience it.. perfect for breakfast 😋 👌 😍.. must try Bun maska and Paneer puff... Osmania biscuits also..

Great place to get Chai, Maska bun and Osmania biscuits. The outside eating arrangement is alright and could be bigger. But the staff is great and is always standing by ready to pick up trash and clean the tables!
Most overhyped tea, it's just an experience but if you are looking for taste then try some street vendors. Not living upto hype.. strictly average

Once upon a time wonderful tea has now turned into a cow feed. It had exactly the same taste of tea if we forgot to switch off the flame and it boiled for too long. Worst tea. Has ruined my beautiful memories associated with it.

Tried their famous muska bun and Nilofer tea. Loved the buttery bun. Tea was strong for my taste. It was pretty busy. No parking space. No space to sit and eat. Can give order digitally and get your takeaway. Bought some biscuits,  yet to taste.

The iconic place of Hyderabad for Irani chai, variety of biscuits and other bakery itemsnThe place is located close to lakdi ka pul metro station and opens at 5amnSo good for early morning tea cravings

Had wonderful tea 🍵 time with friends at night.nnAll items are fresh items.nn🅿️ Minimum Parking available only for 2 wheeler vehiclesn📌 Pin point google map locationn₹ All types of payment available heren🍵 Tasty Tea with huge snack items with 🍞 and bunsnnFor thise who plan to visit on CAR we have to park in street.nn7 km only from Charminar tourism place.nnMust visit place
One of the best teas in Hyderabad 8/10, the quality of milk is good too, the coffee is good as well 6/10. While taking your bun maska, just make sure there is enough cream.

Caffé Niloufer is a well-loved spot in Hyderabad, known for its Niloufer Special Chai and a variety of delicious sweets, cakes, and snacks. The hygiene and quality of their products are top-notch, and they follow strict standards in preparation. While the Himayatnagar branch stands out with its better parking and more accessible layout, the Lakdikapul branch struggles with parking and crowd management, especially on weekends. Despite the parking issues at one location, the overall experience is pleasant, with a relaxed atmosphere and great tasting food. It’s a reliable choice for tea lovers, families, and anyone craving a sweet treat.

Cafe niloufer is a tea stall cum cafe very famousnnFor its tea and bun maskaannSelf serving is herennFirstly you pay cash or card onlynnNo upi facilities availablennTea has a great taste and bun has a good maskannHappy happy tea time

Cafe Niloufer in Hyderabad is a must-visit for tea lovers. Their tea is rich and flavorful, often compared to Karachi Bakery’s, and truly lives up to the hype. Apart from tea, they offer delicious snacks like veg puffs, Osmania biscuits, fresh bread, and their famous Malai Bun, which pairs perfectly with chai.nnThe cafe also serves a variety of other food items like biryanis and chole bhature. While I didn’t get a chance to try them, they looked incredibly tempting. The place is always buzzing with people, which adds to the lively vibe, though seating is limited and it can get crowded during peak hours. Despite this, the service is quick, so you won’t have to wait too long.nnIf you’re looking for an authentic Hyderabadi tea experience with some tasty snacks and tempting food options, Cafe Niloufer is definitely worth a visit.

Classic Hyderabadi Vibes at Café Niloufer – Red HillsnnIf you’re in Hyderabad and looking for an authentic Irani café experience, Café Niloufer in Red Hills is the place to be. I visited during my vacation and was treated to the city’s legendary combo – maska bun and chai – and I must say, it absolutely lived up to the hype.nnThe chai is rich, strong, and perfectly brewed, while the maska bun is soft, buttery, and melts in your mouth. It’s simple yet incredibly satisfying, especially when enjoyed hot and fresh.nnThat said, be prepared for a crowded atmosphere. This place is always buzzing with locals and tourists alike, which speaks to its popularity. Seating can be tight, and you might need to wait a bit, but once that first sip of chai hits, it’s all worth it.nnA must-visit for chai lovers and anyone wanting to soak in true Hyderabadi flavors and energy

Not a tea drinker by any means but if I drink tea, it would be from niloufer. That's how good it is. Rocher Cookie is an osmania biscuit covered with chocolate and almonds. It's good. The maska bun is just yum

We have tried tea and malai bun as suggested. Malai bun is available till 10am as mentioned at the cafe. My favorite is the Poha. It is quite underrated. It is filled with lots of veggies, cashews and tastes amazing. I would definitely recommend everyone to try this.
SO MANY SNACK ITEMS MUST TRY 👌🏻nBun Maska &nTEA is Unmatched 💥⚡🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟nNote:n* No sittingn* Mostly crowded

Known for its bun muska and tea.  This place is pure nostalgia.. amazing tea and superb bakery products.  The only problem is they don't have the washroom. They could have easily managed it as they have a huge space . Rest everything is good about this place.

title: Cafe Graffiti
address: 8-2-672, 1/A, Rd Number 13, Mithila Nagar, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034, India

reviews_content.text: One of the oldest cafes of banjara hills located at road number 13.nnAffordable prices with good quality & quantity of food.nnWe tried the following items,nnChicken Alfredo Pasta 7/10nBroasted Chicken 9/10nChicken Cheese Mutabbaq 9/10nEgg Mutabbaq 9/10nMeat Mutabbaq 10/10nSpecial Meat Burger 7/10nChicken Zinger Burger 9/10nChicken Zinger Wrap 10/10nMeat Sheekh Kebab 9/10nMocktails 9/10 ( Green Apple recommended )nChocolate Milkshake 8/10nBlackcurrant Milkshake 10/10 ( Highly recommended )nIced Latte Hazelnut 6/10nChocolate Donuts 10/10nnThey aren't serving naans anymore.

Popped into the restaurant with my family poor hygiene conditions there were a lot of mosquitos under the table and were falling in the food,need to look into this matter running a fast food shop in banjara hills with this poor hygiene with all the mosquitos falling in the food is not good for your restaurant reputation owners need to take a serious step to sort this out
One of the old cafe , the food is good and ambience is cozy

It's a hidden gem for sure!💯nnIsse sasta aur acha purey Banjara hills me kahin nahi😂✌️nnWe consider it a sin to visit this place and not order the following items :n- Potato Wedgesn- Chocolate donuts and croissantsn- Chicken Alfredo Pastan- Chicken Muttabaqn- Zinger burger (Beef/Chicken) EtcnnThe only disappointment I faced here was the news about Bhukari rice and kababs,nThey aren't serving these dishes anymore 💔

One of my favourite restraunts in banjara hills! Whenever I'm low on cash,and I want to eat some good tasting food,this is where I go.nThe staff members are super friendly.nThey always suggest the best dish when you don't feel like deciding on your own.nI have went to this restraunt dozens of times,and I've never been disappointed.nThere's even a dedicated family section on the first floor,which ofcourse is wayy better than the ground floor for bachelors.nThe prices are quite reasonable.nInfact,I have found this place to be much cheaper than other restaurants with similar menus.

Hi,nI've visited this place like 2-4 times till now.nnSurely they have improved the ambience and along with that increased the prices.nnAs usual I've tried their Alfredo Pasta which was supposed to be tasty but they have compromised on the quality/taste.nnEven Fries were not pure peri peri like they just sprinkled the peri peri mix but it didn't mixed it well.

Best place for Burgers and pasta.nI tried zinger burger and beef burger here. Hands down it is the best. Also try their potato wedges.nThe burgers are full of flavour and spice.nAnd the interior is too minimalistic.nLove this place.nAlso the food here is HALAL.nGood spot for a lunch date.nShakes here are also good.nP.s Way better than sound cheesy

Great little affordable place offering good some very delicious burgers, fries and Mojitos.nThe beef burgers are some of the bestt in the cityy. The zinger burgers are a little dry though. Apart from that it’s a cozy place offering good ambience, a neat setup and a relaxing quite time.nThe place has gotten much larger after their recent renovation, and prices are still pretty affordable so that’s something really nice.nService is quick and appropriate.nOverall 8/10.

I went there and ordered fish zinger burger and fish and chips to take away for my wife.. but they betrayed me by giving me chicken burger and there were small pieces of fish in fish and chips..date: 08/09/2023 invoice id: 1/005090 time: 9:53pm bill amount: ₹ 400.
The food is great. I just felt the place had a weird smell. They could work a little on their ambience. Nevertheless, it's a good place. The beef burger is must try

I had discovered the place a few years ago and it's one of the best snack places that I have known.nnThe pics include review fornnPotato wedges - love themnArabbiata pizza - was alrightnChicken BBQ sandwich- must trynZaatar pide ( beauty..damn delicious upset that isn't back on the menu yet. It was one of my favourites in the city...a must add on every order here)nCold coffee ( ask to make it strong) and it's thicker than the other known shakes out there.nnPlease bring the zaatar pide back ♥️
Cafe Grafitti serves good burgers, wedges, sandwiches, wraps and mocktails.nA good place for fast foods.
Awesome place to hangout with friends. Service is a bit slow but the tasty food a d ambience will make up for it. Pasta and Zinger burger with Blue Lagoon mocktail is a must try.
Great Place To Chill With Your Family & Friends Where You Can Have a Delicious Food At Affordable Prices...nSo Go & Enjoy!!!

A small quaint cafe in Banjara hills. We walked in pretty late for Hyderabad City standards. But the place had a good vibe and the food was also very tasty. We had wraps and one of their signature dishes which is not on their menu card. They have a lot of other items which are not mentioned in the menu so pls do enquire about it before ordering. We had asked them to suggest some dishes to us. They also served us their fresh made chocolate donut as a complimentary sweet diah. It was really well made. Overall a good experience.

It is a small place where you can find buffet system.The cashier takes money in advance and then becomes least bothered to serve you.nWe ordered French fries and pasta,lime soda. Nothing was good plus the service was very slow.nThe black currant shake was okay.A lillte disappointed with the place.

I visited this cafe many times its a nice place to hangout with friends and is also pocket friendly the ambience is also good and i like the pastas and cocktails . They have crossonts , the chocolate crossont is very good , the crossont is covered with chocolate and is very tasty .
Good place with some unique ambiance but service is not up to the mark considering the prices
Calm place...not much crowded...i like the french fries here... Chiken Mutabaq is also good. ...fish Tempura was tasty but had a bad smell... A cool place to spend time with peace.

Been visiting this place since its inception during our college days, It was our college hangout spot as this place serves food which is VFM and of excellent quality. Over the years they have expanded to two new branches nearby and extended the seating area of this place. If you are visiting this place do try the Reshmi Kebab w Cheese Naan also while ordering mention that you want the kebab wrapped in egg fluff. If you are roll lover try the Sheesh tawook roll and chicken zinger roll on the milkshake side I'd recommend their signature Rose Mango milkshake and Pina colada mention that you'd prefer less ice in milkshake.
Tasty food in affordable price. Quick service. Ambiance is okay okay..you will not find any graffiti inside the restaurant

Enjoy your burger with your little friends cockroaches.nnWas there for 20mins waiting for a person to collect order. As he himself suggested me to sit and he will come to take order.nLater the person sitting on counter said they dont take orders and it is self service.nnUsed to be a best place. Currently its worst

This is the most affordable yet amazing place for delicious food. Here you can have the most yummy fish & chips, fingerlicking good kebabs, lip-smacking pastas, the coolest mocktails & milkshakes. They have more variety to offer. Do visit and enjoy with your friends and family at reasonable prices with fresh food.

This place has a lot of mosquitoes, and every time I plan a visit, I worry about them. Could you please take measures to address this?The place is quite dark, which affects the atmosphere. Improving the lighting and ambiance would make it much more inviting.…food no doubt serves best quality and taste

I have visited this place almost 50-100 times. I can never get bored of it. Budget friendly place with delicious fast food. Halal Chicken is served. No extra GST or any kind of tax. However the new branch on Road no. 12 charges tax. They have added one more floor at the top which is extremely spacious and good for larger gatherings.nMust try : Grill chicken Sub with Strawberry Milkshake
If you don't bring your friends along, don't worry—the mosquitoes will be happy to keep you company.

I ordered 2 Chicken BBQ Burger and took it home.  Ate within 30 min, stale cheese in the burger, chicken patty tasteless, smelling over used oil, bun not fresh. Took a bite, didn't want to, but had to throw the rest. The second burger is straight in the bin! These guys have lost it, the taste is horrible. Wasted my 500 rupees!!! Not recommended. Period!
This cafe is ideal when you’re planning to hangout with group of friends. I’ve been to this place many times however I got some snaps of Chicken Lucknawi Wrap and orange slush.

title: Cravery Cafe
address: Film Nagar, Plot No 416A, Rd Number 78, Phase III, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India

reviews_content.text: Cozy place, good ambience, food tastes really good. It would be better if the portion of serving could be increased. The size of the pizza was quite small, the price to quantity ratio wasn't that satisfactory but the taste was good. We did try vegetarian options only on the menu.nThis place has a collection of few books as well for reading during quick bites or solo sessions.nnSurprisingly I liked rasam rice here, this place has a variety of coffee options as well. The cheese pulled garlic bread was good too. Paneer panza is also a must try.nnOverall I would ratenFood taste 4.5/5nFood portion 3/5nPrice ₹₹₹nAmbience 4/5nService 5/5

Cravery cafe is a perfect place for causal dining with family and friends. Ambience is so well designed andnThe night view adds a magical touch to the overall experience, making it a perfect place to unwind.nnThe food menu is somewhat limited but is carefully curated and each of the dishes that we tried were high presentation and were tastefully done. The options are much more for waffles, desserts, coffee and quenchers and they are delightful.i would recommend blue berry cheese cake is the best dessert in this cafe.The tables are set with a QR code which has the menu there is a small device to call for the attender for service or for the bill.nThe staff was really quick and helpful. Overall a well spent family time with yummy food.

I recently visited a charming cafe in Hyderabad that left a lasting impression on me. The cozy ambiance with soft lighting and comfortable seating made it a perfect spot to unwind. The staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive, adding to the overall pleasant experience.nnThe menu offered a delightful variety of dishes and beverages. I particularly enjoyed their signature coffee blend, which was rich and flavorful. The food was well-prepared and presented beautifully, showcasing both taste and aesthetic appeal.nnWhile the prices were slightly on the higher side, the quality of the food and service justified the cost. One area for improvement could be the waiting time for the orders, as it was a bit longer than expected.nnOverall, my visit to this cafe was a delightful experience, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a cozy place to enjoy good food and drinks in Hyderabad.

Cravery is one of the best cafe hangout with friends and family. They have a plenty options of menu choices like  Chinese, Italian North Indian and South Indian stuff. They have refreshing drinks desserts too. Ambience looks very cozy. Great hospitality. Had a great experience. Worth of money. Highly recommended .

Great place nearby for a scrumptious breakfast. Had english breakfast which had sausages, omlette, mushrooms, toast and butter. Kids liked the pancakes and waffles 🧇 with chocolate syrup. There is a selection of books too. Overall a nice place to eat and meet.

Went to Cravery Cafe for dessert and ordered the Nutella cheesecake, was super disappointed with the taste. They have a QR code system for ordering, but the website wasn’t working properly. Thankfully, the staff stepped in and helped fix the order. Overall, not the best experience.

The staff has always been welcoming it's a very cozy cafe best to hangout with friends or even has a quite good workspace area and outdoor seating is also available where smoking is allowednFood has always been very comforting love mac and cheese of this place!!
I visited today cravery cafe. I ordered  panner pizza ,cheese chilli garlic toast & cappuccino. Food is very tasty. Nice coffee.Ambience is looking pretty good and great service.
Delicious food, price is medium high, cozy boho ambience. A cute and classy go to cafe with your friends.

This cafe is on the list of my most favourite places to visit with friends! Their Mac&Cheese is the cheesiest and the best version I've ever had in Hyderabad. I come back here for their Mac&Cheese and mozerella sticks!nFlaky chicken popcorn, cheese pull garlic bread, grill chicken and garlic prawns are must try!nnNot a fan of desserts here, pretty average.nnAmong the beverages, smoked Rosemary and Blueberry and Caramel Frappe are too good!
Nice quiet and small place with good atmosphere. Coffee was decent and went well with the chocolate cake. Service is nice not professional but very welcoming.
Loved the grilled chicken with mash and veggies. Very filling as portion was generous, including the sauces! Kiran was especially kind with his service. Washroom was clean!! Will definitely revisit.
Ambience was good. Drinks were good. Coming to food, we ordered the cheese pull garlic bread. It was just okay, didn’t like it that much.
Cute cozy corner with really yummy food.nMust try: the OG Mac & cheese, Moroccan paneer, popcorn chicken, strawberry mojito,smoked rosemary and blueberry

Cozy little place that serves delicious food.nn1. Hazelnut latte - Served in a big cup, quantity more than a conventional cup of coffee, tasted great. 5/5 🌟n2. Parisienne carrot and cheese soup - perfect especially on rainy days, the flavours were subtle and pleasant. 5/5 🌟n3. Peri peri chicken mac n cheese - if you’re craving for something cheesy then you must try this. Well deserved hype. 4.5/5 🌟nnPrices on the higher side(except for coffee).

If you are looking for a cafe to hangout and spend time with a friend/friends and talking over some great food - You found the right place.nMy personal favourites were the Chicken Forestiere and Nawabi Chicken Panza (Reminds you of Kheema buns). If cheese and cheese pulls are what you crave - Go for the Mac n Cheeze without a second hesitation. For those with a sweet tooth the OCD Sundae is a sweetheart. Otherwise for mild sweet desert - Tres leches garnished with rose petals and nuts is great too

I loved the food here, it was cooked very well with good amount of attention to detail.nI would recommend this place to many but I'll say that it is expensive and sometimes the food quantity might not live up to your expectations.n10/10 foodn8/10 servicen5/10 food quantity (some items)

I had dinner with  my family. Cafe looks very cozy and greenery looks awesome . Food was Delicious their  soups , chilli garlic chicken, south indian rice bowls, mac n cheese is yummy 😋 I recommend blue berry cheese cake is the best dessert in this cafe. Great hospitality. One of the best cafe in Hyderabad.

From aesthetics to yummy food, this place offers a peaceful lunch with your loved ones. I just fell in love with their hot chocolate. We ordered prawns fry which we finished in a jiff. Mac and cheese was good too.nPeaceful ambience and work friendly too.

It’s a good restaurant for any casual dining. They have both indoor and outdoor (very limited) dining options available. The location is good and is situated right next to the main road. Breakfast options are good and most importantly they serve tasty food. Their service is touch slow but that’s a trade-off to get fresh food I guess. I would recommend this place.

Wide range food menu, good decor, excellent service and equally good food sums up this place. Love the visual appeal of the food in the menu and on the screen, that helps one to choose. Roasted Tomato and garlic soup, farm fresh deep dish pan pizza, Chicken nawabi rice, burnt garlic fried rice and caramel cheese cake made the day. Equally good were the bubble tea, a voluminous cappuccino and jade rings hot tea
Great selection of food and drinks. Amazing taste and great ambience.

I Visited Here At Night And It Had Rained A Bit Earlier That Day So I Didn’t Like The Ambience That Pleasing (You Might Have A Better Experience On A Better Day Good Luck) I Ate The Mac N Cheese And I Would Say It Has One Of The Best Cheese Pulls (You Could Look At The Pic For Reference) And I Also Had Another Dish Which I Wouldn’t Recommend I Don’t Even Remember It’s Name (Maybe A Panza a Veg One, Idk For Sure. Let Me Know If You Had It There’s A Pic Down)
Decent place for small meeting  , well maintained with tasty food

I spent an afternoon working here and the service is absolutely excellent. The men working here are so attentive, the bathroom was clean, and I would happily go back.nThe food was a hit or miss. The Moroccan paneer starter didnt have spicy in the description but it was covered with a crust of red chilli. The cheese toast was fine. The coffee is good and I will happily go back and try other things on the menu.

We tried the baby roasted allow rasam and it was fantastic. Then we called for three leaf apple walnut salad and it was damn good too. Good food, superb ambience. Highly recommended. It was very kind of Bharat chef to cater to our special request of no onion and garlic food.

Great option for a leisurely lunch. Welcoming ambience and courteous staff, decor is chic and we'll thought through, staff is courteous and the service is quick. Seating arrangement is spread out so it doesn't feel crowded even with a full house.nThe food menu is somewhat limited but is carefully curated and each of the dishes that we tried were high presentation and were tastefully done. The options are much more for waffles, desserts, coffee and quenchers and they are delightful. Overall a wonderful place to spend time and indulge.

Amazing food !!!! I am simply amazed by the quality of food served here. . If you are a cheese lover you will love cheesy garlic bread and mac and cheese. The atmosphere is nice and cosy, the menu ranges from continental to South Indian. Highly recommended if you are around film nagar. Must try !!

title: Theory Patisserie & Cafe
address: Plot No. 178, Rd Number 13, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India

reviews_content.text: We randomly ended up here while in search for a full English breakfast. It is a quiet little place with great ambience for a relaxed meal. The service was quick and excellent. The portion sizes were modest but reasonably priced compared to similar places. We only had the English breakfast and a fried chicken bagel which were both delicious.Overall we were pleased and would definitely consider going there again

The atmosphere is amazing — a perfect place to sit and relax with a cup of coffee. The service was quick, efficient, and fantastic.nnThe food was great in both quality and quantity, definitely worth the price. We had pasta and fries; however, the fries were a bit too oily — something that could be looked into. The frappe was delicious!nnThe lighting in the café really enhances the ambiance and our pictures turned out beautiful. Overall, a wonderful experience! ,❤️❤️🤩🤩
Place and ambience are great but food here is bit disappointing. Tried there burmese khao suey which is absolutely delicious. Desserts are not upto the mark. They could improve there service.

Randomly found this cafe when we were searching for best cafes in Hyderabad for lunch and trust me this was our best find. Located in a nice quiet location of Jubliee hills this offers both indoors n outdoor sitting options. But as I can't stand cigarette smoke smell we opted for indoor seating.nnWe being vegetarian, ordered these following items from their listn1. Hot chocolate with marshmallow - just too yummmyn2. Korean Bun - perfectly baked n must tryn3. Farmhouse sourdough pizza - super light n made to perfectionn4. Peri peri fries - that fiery kick hits the right spotsn5. Almond croissant- that warm flaky mildy sweet croissant is worth the hypen6. Basil pesto pasta - it was tasty blend of pesto, olive oil and parmesan cheese with a side serve of soft bread.n7. Berry cheesecake just melts in your mouth with the tangy berry hint in every bitennWould love to go back and try some more of their food, beverages n not to forget their desserts.

being a Sunday I preferred to book a table, to avoid disappointment. Checked on Google and there was an option to book a table on their Google my business page. We did book a table for five. Immediately ely got confirmation mail too. On reaching there they said they don’t reserve tables and they never received any intimation from Google. They had to join two table and provide us a sitting arrangement. A bit irritating. Other wise a cool place to hangout with friends casual meeting . The potions are very small and we ended up ordering more number of items. Taste of food is good. There is valet parking which is a blessing in those norrow places.
Nice cafe with good ambience and decent servicenFood tastes good but a little overpricednCan enjoy a fun evening

Very limited vegetarian options. We ordered the bagel and it turned up cold on the inside and wasn’t properly reheated either. Nachos were not good either. Smoothie bowl was decent as well as the English breakfast. Vietnamese cold coffee was watery. Over all the place is overpriced for below average food.

Disappointed with the ExperiencennI visited this cafe hoping to enjoy a meal and spend some quiet time working on my laptop, like many people do at cafes. Unfortunately, we were refused service simply because we had our laptops with us. We hadn’t even settled in or asked for charging points—just intended to order food and quietly work for a while.nnThere was no prior signage or communication about a no-laptop policy, and the way we were asked to leave felt unwelcoming and unfair. A more polite or professional explanation would have been appreciated if there was a genuine policy in place.nnAs customers, we expect basic courtesy, especially when we’re ready to order and be respectful of the space. Sadly, I won’t be returning, and I hope the management reconsiders how they treat potential patrons in the future.nnWould you like me to tailor this based on the tone you prefer (polite, direct, sarcastic, etc.) or mention the restaurant name?nnDisappointed with the ExperiencennI visited this cafe hoping to enjoy a meal and spend some quiet time working on my laptop, like many people do at cafes. Unfortunately, we were refused service simply because we had our laptops with us. We hadn’t even settled in or asked for charging points—just intended to order food and quietly work for a while.nnThere was no prior signage or communication about a no-laptop policy, and the way we were asked to leave felt unwelcoming and unfair. A more polite or professional explanation would have been appreciated if there was a genuine policy in place.nnAs customers, we expect basic courtesy, especially when we’re ready to order and be respectful of the space. Sadly, I won’t be returning, and I hope the management reconsiders how they treat potential patrons in the future.nnWould you like me to tailor this based on the tone you prefer (polite, direct, sarcastic, etc.) or mention the restaurant name?

Had an amazing experience at Theory Patisserie and Café! A special shoutout to Nuel, who went above and beyond to make our visit memorable. Not only was the food absolutely delicious, but Nuel’s service truly stood out - warm, attentive, and genuinely thoughtful. It’s rare to come across someone who takes such pride in their work. He made great recommendations and ensured we were well taken care of throughout.nnNuel definitely deserves recognition and I hope to see him climb up the ranks — his dedication and hospitality are top-notch!

Food is not too great and the desserts are too good and the chocolate strawberry and the service is not that great.we got a cake from outside which they didn’t allow to cut it some likes the cake from some places they want to take there own restaurant cake and cut which we are disappointed with and we requested them but they didn’t so the management should behave in a better way bec they should have allowed so the customers leave with satisfaction and will again visit the restaurant

Theory is a cafe I've wanted to visit for a long time! This place is beautiful, especially in the rainy season. The vibe is cozy, warm & it's perfect for any occasion.nnThey have a diverse menu and Theory is well known for their delicious dessert options.nnWe tried Butter Chicken Cigars, Cheesy Onion Rings & Cheesy Garlic Bread for starters. We ordered a vegetarian pizza & Alfredo pasta for the main course. All of the dishes were mouthwatering and served quickly.nnI'd recommend Theory to anyone looking for a good place to spend time with their friends during this rainy season.

so I ordered here affogato nd hazelnut frappe not so gud I found paper in affogato frappe was not gud no flavour no energy in staff u have to call the 2 3 times ambience was okay not a gud experience here

Having been a regular at Theory for quite some time now, I must say it's always held a special place in my heart. Recently, they've revamped their menu, and let me tell you, it's better than ever. The ambiance has this calm, welcoming vibe that just draws you in from the moment you step through the door.nnNow, let's talk drinks. Theory doesn't disappoint in this department either. Whether you're into teas, milkshakes or mocktails, they've got something to quench your thirst. And the best part? You get good quality and quantity for the amount you pay.nnSure, they only have one washroom, but hey, at least it's clean! Plus, with the fairy lights twinkling around, it's the perfect setting for a romantic date night.nnNow, let's get to the good stuff - desserts! Oh boy, where do I even begin? Their blueberry cheesecake is an absolute must-try, and don't even get me started on the chocolate cake. And if you're into bite-sized treats, their small cupcakes are pretty darn good too.nnOh, and did I mention they offer valet parking? Talk about convenience! Overall, Theory ticks all the boxes for a perfect dining experience, whether you're catching up with friends or treating your special someone to a night out.
If you are thinking you come here eat and at the same time do some of your work on laptop the management does not allow that.nnThey want you toeat and chat nothing more.nnNever expected this.
Good food and ambience. Must try Thai green curry bowl
Cute cafe in Jubliee hills.nPrice is very reasonable and the ambiance is amazing.nPasta and fries were tasty. The piri piri bagel tasted a bit like Korean bun but still good.

I love the ambience of this place. Its decoration and background music are relaxing hence making this venue a perfect place for conversation with friends, dating dinner or enjoying a good coffee as you work alone on your laptop.nnThe food and beverage menu is large and they have plenty of healthy options along with vegan and gluten-free food. All are available from morning till evening.nnJuice and milkshake options are not that extensive but you will find the top classics.nnThe service is friendly and helpful and free wifi is available.

Went post dinner for dessert .nThey have indoor and outdoor seating .nWe preferred indoor cause of smoking zone .nThey have so many desserts on display and all of them are tempting .nNeatly displayed and tastes delicious.nWe had vanilla flan and tres leches .nBoth of them were lip smacking.
Over priced but I like the croissant only ! Not recommended Turkish eggs ! Not good even English muffins

VERY HUMILIATING SERVICE - Just because I ordered only 2 coffee and a peri peri French fries and a Theory Spl pizza and opened my laptop because of my last minute urgent work call the staff came said sir you We do not allow work calls in our cafe  I came at 10:30 and left at 2:30 so as per the management they didn't like the amount of money I spend compared to to the time I spend.nnI did ask the staff if they want me to pay extra for the WIFI i was willing to!!!!nnThe steward said you need to leave as you have been for a very long time and occupying a table!!!!!nnThis was so humiliating for me, because I came to India after 3 years and wanted to come to a cafe which has a ambiance this is the service I get.nnI think you can only come eat and smoke nothing more is allowed, the owner and the management should have a rule board outside the cafe.nnFelt so BAD.
We recently visited this place with family. Great ambiance and amazing food. They really took good care of us all. The service and food is exceptional.

These people calculate the hours you sit even if u make a bill of more than 3k for a table. Not sure how this is applicable for guests sitting for more than an hour. Hope the management looks into this, as never have i ever experienced such a rule in restuarant which says vacate ur table post certain hours. Bill for ur management to refer and check

Theory Cafe is an enchanting haven. With its cozy ambiance, it offers a unique experience. The menu boasts delicious treats, and the staff is knowledgeable and passionate. It's a must-visit for anyone seeking delicious nourishment and stimulating conversations.
The food was good but the service was bad. I had ordered pitta platter and after 20-30 minutes they said they cannot serve, overall place was good but service was slow

Nice ambience, great food (smaller portions though), and very friendly staff.nnNot to owner: My main complaint is that they serve 500ml water bottles that are 30 rupees each. These are offered by default as though they are free. I would expect them to offer normal drinking water by default and give me bottled water only when I ask for it. The culture of bottled water, which is a trend post COVID and which most restaurants are now exploiting in the name of hygiene, should go away. Please do your bit to reduce plastic waste.

It’s one of my favourite cafes in Hyderabad. The asthetics are to die for whether you visit during morning, afternoon or evening. The food is yum.nI’ve tried their large variety of croissants, pizzas, cinnamon rolls andncoldbrew. All have been pretty amazing. Love love this place

Place is excellent! Location is pristine and beautiful! Food is tasty, especially the prawns! Coffee was excellent, well brewed. Pizza is too thick in terms of the crust and a bit chewy.. Price is the main discussion, too expensive, not worth at all. Many other cafes which taste better are much cheaper. This may not be a concern for this Cafe as customers throng this place. Can visit for 1 time, it will change your mind...

Great place! They serve excellent coffee and delicious pastries, making it a perfect spot to relax or catch up with friends. The vibe is cozy and welcoming, with a great atmosphere that makes you want to stay longer. Definitely a must-visit for coffee lovers!

title: Cafe Niloufer Premium Lounge - Banjara Hills
address: Divine Banjara - AMN, 8-2-685/P2 & P3, Road No. 12, Venkateswara Colony, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034, India

reviews_content.text: Cafe Niloufer: A Bustling, Multi-Level ExperiencenCafe Niloufer is a three-storied establishment known for its heavy crowds on both the ground and first floors, suggesting a lively, non-premium atmosphere in these areas. For those seeking a more peaceful experience, the cafe offers a second-floor premium section with an hourly charge and minimum billing.nWhile it might not be ideal for a quiet retreat due to its busy, buzzing, and most happening ambiance, it's an excellent choice if you enjoy a vibrant and energetic environment. The cafe is highly regarded for its good food and a wide, continuously upgrading variety of options, contributing to an overall nice experience.

Tea taste is good. Must try Niloufer BUN MASKA along with tea.nThree types of tea powder are sold.nApart from them bakery items like cakes, biscuits, bread, etc are sold.nSelf service as well as separate sitting is there.nWeekends huge crowd.nRest rooms for both men and women are provided.nTables should be increased near self service.

We there there for an art exhibition at CCT Spaces and this was the only outlet closest to the venue. Got addicted to Maska Bun. Nilofar’s tea had unique taste. I also tried some snacks. + Samosas. This is surprisingly a vegetarian only restaurant. Ambience was amazing, huge set up and lot of room to go around.nnThe owner of Cafe Niloufer in Hyderabad is A. Babu Rao, and his son, Shashank, also plays a significant role in the business. Babu Rao started the cafe in 1978 with a vision to create a chai that embodies the spirit of Hyderabad

One of the premium outlets of Hyderabad and it dont require any introduction.nnFirst of all lets discuss why this is premium outlet?nPeople often complain that Niloufer is expensive- No it is not. Just look at their service and the taste. If you want to have comfort food this is the place.nnBeing a north indian my taste buds are adapted to the taste of Niloufer’s dishes.nnRecommendations-nAloo ParanthanMasala Kulcha SandwichnMasala ColanVeg fried rice with chilly paneer

Cafe Niloufer is huge and has a very gd variety of food..their seating is big and very spacious and  you have your privacy..its a multicuisine restaurant and i loved the food .Everything was good except one thing which was a complete shocker that comes in the end..when we asked for water they served it in small disposable bottles instead of a glass..when we asked for the bill we noticed that they hv charged us for water served and it was a ridiculous amount.
