Firstly water is the first thing that anyone serves in a restaurant and if they were going to charge for it they should have mentioned  it right in the beginning. The waiters always ask if we would like to have bottled water or regular water and then the customer is free to choose. But that was not the case here. It felt very cheap that something like this can happen to you in a high-end restaurant. I felt very let down as I had to pay for something that I was not told about and dint ask for..it's just about being upfront about it because it left a bad taste n experience..
Best place for tea and maska bun. its ambience and service super 👌 taste is answsome

Indulging in the perfect duo at Nilofer Café – refreshing Nilofer Chai paired with the crispy, delicious Khara Bun. Simple pleasures, unbeatable taste! ☕🍞nn#NiloferCafe #NiloferChai #KharaBun #HyderabadEats #FoodieDiaries #ChaiLove #CafeCulture #LocalFlavors

Paying Rs.100 for a tiny cup of tea? Hurts. Hurts in places you didn’t even know existed. 😜nnBut then again… Hyderabadi hokar agar Niloufer ki Irani chai nahi pi, toh kya kiya miya?nnWhen you’re craving chai vibes but also battling open pores and the heat like a skincare warrior, this one’s a solid win. 😅nnThe crowd? Basically a Charminar branch copy-paste.nBut the vibe and ambience? Total 4-star.

Happy to be promptly seated on arrival, inspite of being busy on Sunday evening. The steward welcomed me with a smile. Veg Haleem was on the special Ramzan menu and we enjoyed it like no tomorrow. It was marvellous. We tasted many other non veg haleems and this veg Haleem was nice. As usual Bun Maska and tea was spot on.

Went here with my office colleagues for breakfast.nAtmosphere is goodnFood taste is incrediblenQuite expressivenLots of optionsnMust try special chai, Bun Maska, Paneer paratha.nnCame here 2nd time , had same wonderful food.
Cafe Niloufer is expensive, with prices around 100. However, it is a beautiful and comfortable place to visit.
Niloufer has amazing variety of chai and Osmania biscuits along side of a huge collection of veg food & bakery items.

Best tea here is the standard version of Niloufer char, bun maska and Osmania biscuits. Butter almond cookies were also good. The mixed cookie box was a huge hit for gifting.nnSkip the special tea. Too much of sugar despite us asking them to reduce it. The quick service area in ground floor does the job.

The food is good. However.. the tea could be better. The maska bun and onion samosas are a must try.nThe ginger tea is too strong but good. The Cheesy coleslaw MG is good.nnOptions for desserts are also good. Their Rasmalai Delight is their highly recommended dessert.nnThe service is fast. The staff are very attentive.nThe place is huge and tidy.

Pretty expensive place but located at the prime location in Banjara Hills. Tea will cost 100 rs, maska bun 80 rs. Tea was very flavourful and i really loved it thought it was super expensive and you will get quantity enough for 2. Crowded during weekends and they have valet parking

I can say that this place is Heaven for Vegetarian lovers. I’m a regular customer, I liked the new Royal high-tea buffet menu which is a 5 star rated from my side, it is filled with mouth watering cuisines, all dishes are crafted to perfection by the chef & the experience of dining in Turkish ware along with ambience is absolutely pleasant. The privacy is also truly divine in this premium lounge. The service from the staff is amazing, especially from  dear Prabhat, who always exhibits an exceptional hospitality as per customer preferences & food satisfaction ✌️👌
I liked their tea, bun maska and paneer Paratha. Good ambience and service. A little pricey though.
Worth every penny fine hangout place
Best place and good tea and maska bun. We pay here for it's ambience and service.
We had ginger tea and bun maska. Both are really good. But tea is overpriced(150rs)no doubt tea is really good. Bun maska was also good. It tastes best when its hot

Visited for the first time after 11.00 pm. Got valet parking. Ground floor is rush and 1st floor is the table service.nBought tea and bun maska which is tasty. One of the best tea in hyderabad. Tried their  tea powder at home and couldn't get the taste but better than other tea powers.nBun is too soft and melted in the mouth when dipped in the tea. Worth the late night drive. Can go with family.

Honestly this place is the most overhyped place of Hyderabad, the special tea costs 150₹ and special coffee costs 120₹. Nothing worth the price.nNo service as it has self service but before you get the order the service is bit messy, no one knows what they are attending to serve the correct order in less time.nAbout special tea, nothing was special in it, i'd prefer ordinary tapri tea than this.nAbout special coffee ufff it was just a Nescafe nothing else, nothing special in it, so better visit any cafe to have your coffee, atleast you can enjoy the service and ambience with quality of coffee.nBun maska, if you have eaten the bun maska in Pune then please do not try this as it is not up to the mark.nYeah the only thing I love was Rasmalai pastry, it was at 140₹ but yeah it was totally worth the price and the taste was delicious.nn- ₹ahul Mo₹e

⭐⭐⭐⭐nnA Delightful Experience with a Few HiccupsnnI recently visited Niloufer Cafe and had a mostly positive experience with a variety of items:nn- Tea: Simply amazing! One of the best teas I've had in a long time.n- Bun Maska: Absolutely fantastic. The bun was incredibly soft, and the butter was perfectly balanced!n- Vada Pav: Wonderful. It made me feel like I was in Mumbai or Pune.n- Tarri Poha: A bit disappointing. It lacked flavor, and I had to add extra salt. It didn't quite live up to the taste of Nagpur's Tarri Poha.n- Belgian Chocolate Croissant: It was good, but not as authentic as a European croissant.n- Osmania Biscuits: Excellent. They melt in your mouth seamlessly.n- Tawa Pulao with Raita: Decent enough.nnOverall, Niloufer Cafe offers a delightful experience with a few areas for improvement. It's a great place to enjoy a variety of dishes and beverages, with some items standing out more than others. I highly recommend trying their tea and Osmania biscuits!

Went to Café Niloufer a few days back, and man, that place was packed even at 11:30 pm. Had to wait a bit before snagging a spot upstairs. Downstairs was crazy busy, no room to move. Good thing they had valet parking.nnNow, about the food. Tried their special chai, and it was awesome. Lemon tea was a hit with my friends and family – they couldn't stop talking about it.nnBut let me tell you about the real star – the Bun Maska. It was crazy good – soft, warm, and a bit sweet. We started with two, but couldn't resist and ordered a couple more to eat there and a couple to take away.nnWe also tried the Poha, but honestly, it was a bit plain on its own, no salt at all. But when you mix it with that side gravy thing, it becomes delicious.nnOverall, dealing with the crowd was worth it for those buns and chai. Café Niloufer, you got a fan in me.

I went to the private lounge on third floor. Overall experience was good. Certain food was not served on time. Their pastry is amazing. Third floor ambience is wonderful but costly I feel it's worth the money. Food portion is also good

Food tastes good sometimes and just average sometimes. The famous maska buns tasted different everytime I ate but the overall taste is good. Service is good but it'd be rushing at peak hours. The place is usually crowded at nights and on weekends. Chai is better compared to other Niloufer branches. I love the chocolate donut they make...

Visited  with high expectations and tried their Niloufer Special Tea with bun maska. The tea was disappointingly too sweet, but the bun maska was soft, fluffy, and delicious. The menu offers a wide range of options, including tea, coffee, pastries, cakes, and snacks like vada pav, sabudana, subway, and Chinese dishes. However, the overall experience was a 3/5. The mismanagement at the beverages service counter, with no proper queue and chaotic service, detracted from the experience, despite the good ambience. Do visit and share your thoughts!

I had the absolute pleasure of dining at Cafe Niloufer Premium Lounge in Banjara Hills, and without a doubt, it deserves nothing less than a perfect 5/5 rating.nnThe Irani chai at this establishment is a true masterpiece. Its aroma alone is enough to enchant the senses, and the taste is nothing short of exceptional. Paired with the bun masala, it was a delightful journey through a world of rich, sweet, and savory flavors.nnThe onion rings were a revelation in the world of fried treats – golden and crispy on the outside, tender and flavorful on the inside. A perfect appetizer that set the bar high.nnThe dragon chili mushrooms were an explosion of flavors, offering just the right amount of spice and a texture that was both crispy and succulent. It's a dish that keeps you coming back for more.nnAs for the spaghetti aglio e olio, it was a beautiful example of the elegance of simplicity. The pasta was cooked to perfection, and the garlic-infused oil added a heavenly dimension to the dish. It was a taste sensation that I won't soon forget.nnCafe Niloufer Premium Lounge goes beyond just serving food; it offers an unforgettable experience. The service was impeccable, and the lounge's ambiance was both upscale and inviting. For any food enthusiast, this place is a hidden gem that deserves to be explored. I can't recommend it highly enough, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit to savor these exquisite dishes once again. A resounding 5/5 rating is well-deserved!

title: Lé Vantage Café Bar
address: 195/A, Rd Number 13, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India
description: Stylish haunt with drinks & global fare. Airy, European-style venue with a terrace serving global cuisine alongside cocktails, wine & beer.

reviews_content.text: Le Vantage is a perfect place for causal dining with family and friends. Ambience is so well designed that you can capture all your moments in group pictures,  selfies and make it memorable. Talking about food, delicious Hummus with Pita Bread, mouth watering thin crust pizza, authentic Shorba with bread, creamy Pasta and refreshing mocktails. The staff was really quick and helpful. Overall a well spent family time with yummy food. The best part of Le Vantage, it is a pet friendly place.

Food was very good, each of the item was delicious. We Ordered :Pork Pepperoni- Very GoodnLamb Goulash with Homemade Fettuccine - AwesomenBBQ Chicken Wings- OkayishnBaklawa with Ice cream - oknBrownie Espresso with Vanillace cream - very very goodnalthough they are bit costly. And also, you will not get any sort of discount.Ambience was also very good

Food is reasonably priced, but the taste isn’t exactly top-notch. It’s not bad, but it’s not great either. The ambiance is really nice, though. You’ll even see dogs there, which is a great treat for dog lovers.

Been here a few times. it’s a cute, cozy spot with a really nice vibe. The ambience is always on point and the food is yum.nnBut this time I tried their Tiramisu and it was a letdown — not as creamy or rich as expected. Definitely not their best dessert.nnStill a nice place overall, just wouldn’t recommend the Tiramisu.
This place was truly amazing, with a stunning ambiance that set the tone for a wonderful experience. The food was delicious, making it a perfect spot to relax and indulge.

Le Vantage Café is known for its exceptional ambience and is an excellent spot for a relaxing outing. The night view adds a magical touch to the overall experience, making it a perfect place to unwind.nnThe **Peri Peri Chicken Pizza** is a must-try, packed with flavorful spices and a perfectly balanced tangy kick. The pizza is freshly made with a crispy base and generous toppings, making it a delight for your taste buds.nnThe combination of delicious food and the soothing night atmosphere makes Le Vantage Café a highly recommended place to visit, especially for food lovers and those looking for a cozy dining experience.

Excellent ambience. This has both out door & indoor seating. Outdoor is more of smoking zone & Indoor is not. However, if you want to really enjoy the atmosphere, visit this at night hours, prefer out doors. It is cozy and great, pet friendly too...nnComing to food, it is just fine. Too pricy and I think, we can have good places that can offer better than this. But if price is not a concern, I think you can give it a try!

This is a great spot for casual outing. The ambience is lovely, the service is quick, and it’s fully pet-friendly—you can even take your pet inside. There’s plenty of parking. Overall, a good place to visit!

Really nice ambience and service. Food could have been better. Tenderloin was asked to be made medium rare but ended up being closer to well done. Kaaliya is an amazing host.nnNB: They are not selling alcohol because of some license issue but the menu isn't updated.

Veg food option limited. But i go there just for cafe frappe and avocado sandwiches which are great. Its pet friendly and the vibe is very cool and aesthetic filled with plants.nI tried nachos and quesadillas which were below average.
Food, Service and Ambience are top notch. One of the best pet friendly Cafe with good food and vibe. We have enjoyed a lot.

The ambience of this place is the best part! We spent a beautiful evening here, there was no loud music and such beautiful ambience that we could have amazing conversations and the staff was very cooperative and we weren't disturbed at all. The food was pretty much average. And cocktails too. There weren't many options. But we had an unforgettable evening sitting and chatting. The Christmas decor and vibes are on point.

I just loved it. The pizza, the coffee, everything. There was this cute huge siberian to welcome me and he was so good letting me click his pics. The place has multiple seating options all giving a different vibe with the same theme. It's so quiet around and the service, quick and top notch. Go for it.nnRecommended

One of the best cafes I've visited, in terms of ambience, very cozy interior with cute table lights, which will make your dining experience awesome. Best place if you're looking to go on a date.nI've tried their cream of broccoli soup and pesto pasta. The soup was fine, but the pasta was amazing. Will definitely visit again to try other items in their menu.
Loved the ambience!!! Me and my frnds had a great time there. Quantity of the food is really better than other cafes. Loved the pasta and strawberry milkshake. A very good place to click pictures.

This cafe offers a cozy and inviting atmosphere, making it the perfect spot to relax or catch up with friends. The coffee is rich and expertly brewed, with a variety of options for every taste—from strong espressos to smooth lattes. The pastries are freshly baked and pair wonderfully with the drinks, especially the croissants and muffins. The staff is friendly and always ready to make personalized recommendations. Whether you’re looking for a quiet corner to work or a lively place to enjoy a chat, this cafe creates the ideal environment. Highly recommend for anyone in search of great coffee and a warm vibe!

This Bar offers a charming vintage ambiance that captures the eye upon entering. With its cozy and aesthetically pleasing decor, it's an inviting spot for a casual outing. However, my experience here has been mixed.nnWhile the ambiance is undoubtedly a highlight, I found the seating arrangements to be somewhat uncomfortable, with limited space between tables. This detracted from the overall comfort of the dining experience.nnUnfortunately, my disappointment extended to the menu offerings. Despite visiting the café bar multiple times over the past few months, I failed to find dishes or drinks that truly appealed to my palate. While taste preferences vary, I found both the food and cocktails to be rather average, lacking the wow factor I had hoped for.nnAdditionally, the pricing at Lé Vantage Café Bar leans towards the higher end, which may not be justified by the quality of the offerings. While I wouldn't discourage others from giving it a try, especially for the ambiance alone, I do believe that the establishment could benefit from refining its menu and focusing more on customer service.nnOverall, Lé Vantage Café Bar falls short of expectations, with its standout feature being the ambiance. While it may not leave you with a feeling of regret, it also fails to deliver anything truly exceptional. For me, the food and drinks were passable but didn't leave a lasting impression.

Came in here for late lunch on a Saturday. What was immediately alluring about here, is the generous amounts of spaciousness. The location, accessible easy car parking with valet (though you may not need it unless the parking lot gets full), the luxurious welcome arch and gateway which in particular makes you feel like you're transported to a different world are really good. On entering you will definitely like the variety of seating arrangements, whether be it the open area with shades, a cafe like area and then the more traditional restaurant setup on the first floor. The quality of ambience is top notch and this is really what you should come to experience when here. Come here prepared to spend more than an hour, eat at a leisurely pace, bring a book to read, etc.nnNow let's about the meal experience in itself. We had chicken wings, pita bread with hummus for appetizers followed by pesto cream pasta and tofu broccoli rice Chinese Bowl. The food is more or less 4 stars for their taste, presentation and portions. The food is meant to be enjoyed a bit bland as the taste is subtle. Portions were good for 2. The wait staff were friendly though they seemed a bit understaffed even to support a modest crowd.nnOur meal worked out to 1000INR per person, so you know you really paid for the ambience (which is why you should come here prepared for the experience and not the food by itself). 5 stars since I pretty much expected a very friendly ambience for a date with my loved one, and then got it here!

Le Vantage Café in Hyderabad is a chill spot to hang out with friends or just relax by yourself. The vibe is cozy, with a cool mix of modern and rustic décor that makes you feel right at home. The menu is packed with delicious options, but their coffee and pastries are definitely the stars perfectly brewed and super tasty. Whether you’re in the mood for a sweet treat or something savory, they’ve got you covered. The staff is super friendly, making the whole experience even better. If you’re looking for a laid-back spot to unwind and enjoy some good food and drinks, Le Vantage is definitely worth checking out!

A quick pick of my experiencennI liked the atmosphere and ambience of the outside area, They had sitting arrangements inside the hall as well which was not much happening but can be good for any sort of date.nnTheir hot chocolate was one of the best hot chocolates I had in Hyderabad.nOnion rings were too pricey for the quantity we got.nWe ordered brocolli soup and that was really good.nService was 2.5/5 we personally felt that they are a bit rude especially the girl on the front desk.nnAverage person expenditure is almost around 1000 plus and depens on your count of orders.nnA good place to hangout at last.

Certainly! Here's a generic restaurant review:nnI recently had the pleasure of dining at a cozy little spot that left a lasting impression. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with just the right balance of elegance and comfort. The service was impeccable; the staff were attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely friendly, which enhanced the overall experience.nnThe food was the true highlight. Every dish was thoughtfully prepared, bursting with flavor, and beautifully presented. From the starters to the dessert, each bite was a testament to the chef’s skill and attention to detail. The menu offered a great variety, catering to different tastes and dietary preferences.nnOverall, this place is a gem, perfect for a casual outing or a special occasion. It’s the kind of place that makes you look forward to your next visit. Highly recommended!

An amazing vintage cafe that I've visited for the first time. The tables, chairs and even the stairs. Everything was just perfect. Generally when the place is this aesthetic the food is not great but here even the food was delicious!nMust try:nSpinach and feta mini rollsnCaesar saladnBanoffee pie
Great place with variety of menu for food and for people who drink . And the ambience is quite good and peaceful , the outdoor is so damn good . Except for the rainy days 😅

Spacious seating, outdoor and indoor, multi-seating options makes this a good hang out place with friends and family. Excellent service, decent food range and taste makes it worthy. Though expensive, is a good experience. Restroom ambience is shady, could have been better

The ambience is great. Food was amazing. Service was awesome. The price is slightly on the higher end. Almost 1.5k per person depending on what you order , but the food was absolutely delicious so no complaints there. One issue is that smoking is allowed at tables , so that was a issue for me as people were smoking around nearby and it was a disturbance for me , but overall a good experience at the restaurant
Good ambience but food was just ok as I experienced a bit more salty.nVariety drinks are available.nSmoking and pets allowed.

This is one of my favourite and Definitely recommend this place for a date night or day. I’m simply impressed with everything from the entrance to the exit. The staff is super friendly. There is lots of greenery around which make eyes so delightful.there will be decent crowd on the weekends. The food is just mamma Mia specially the pizzas and I love there fries burger and mocktails.

A very cosy place. Great Ambience. I went here for dinner with my friends. Had a great time. Some of the dishes were really good.nWe tried:n1. Chicken popcornn2. Chilli chicken wingsn3. Nasi gorengn4. Hummus with pitan5. Chicken hot and spicy burgern6. Fish and chipsn7. Banoffe piennI didn't like the fish and chips much but the rest of the dishes were good. The burger was really tasty and hot.nA very good place for a good romantic dinner. A little pricey of course. But if you go in a bunch, it would be reasonable.

title: The Gallery Cafe
address: Kalakriti Art Complex, 8-2-465, Road No 4, Green Valley, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034, India
description: Contemporary coffee shop & art gallery. Modern coffee shop featuring art on display & a global cafe menu of sandwiches, pasta & desserts.

reviews_content.text: If you are looking for a place to spend an afternoon chatting with a friend over good vegetarian food, this is the perfect place. The service is prompt but discrete, there is no distracting music and the place is relatively uncrowded so nobody rushes at you with the bill even before you finish. There are limited vegan options, but the entire menu is vegetarian so you have a lot to choose from. They are also good with minor customisations. Both the dishes we ordered were a little on the spicy side, so if you have spice intolerance, do ask them to tone it down a bit- I found it prefect. The beautiful art work on the walls adds to the ambiance without detracting from the meal. Will certainly revisit.nThere is ample parking inside, which is an added bonus. We took the stairs, but there is also a lift. You can also drop in at the Art Gallery on the way in or out- there is always some interesting exhibition going on there.

A must try place for all the artists!!! Amazing place to showcase your art and also enjoy every picture in detail. Food is also yummiee. We have tried their hot chocolate, cappuccino with added vanilla, paneer sandwich and potato wedges. Completely worth the price and not very costly. The food and ambience both are amazing. A complete vegetarian cafe where we get lost in the paintings♥️
Best place for coffee + Art .nPure veg cafe with very good collection of Art to purchase .nMust visit place for a perfect coffee

This is such a cute cozy cafe. The ambiance is so good so many art pieces the decorations are so good. Coming to the food, it was tasty. The place is super and nice. Would definitely recommend it and I will visit again and bring over my friends.
A cozy little space with nice decor and good food. There's an art gallery below and the cafe is on the first floor.

Recently, we visited The Gallery Cafe ,  located in Banjara Hills. First impressions - it's a decent spot , particularly for art lovers who might enjoy the artistic ambience.nnNow, coming to the food, we tried a variety of items: White Sauce Penne Veg Pasta, French Fries, Vietnamese Iced Coffee, Brownie Shake, and the Capricorn Pizza. To be honest, except for the pizza, everything was quite disappointing. The Capricorn Pizza was good, though not exceptional. It had a typical taste that you'd find in many Hyderabad cafes—satisfying but nothing extraordinary.nnThe two most disappointing items were the White Sauce Penne Pasta and the Vietnamese Iced Coffee. The pasta’s sauce was the biggest letdown. The consistency was thin and watery, far from the creamy texture I expected, and the flavor was bland. Additionally, the portion size of the pasta was a bit underwhelming considering the price, which added to the disappointment.nnAs for the Vietnamese Iced Coffee, it was the most disappointing. We ordered it based on the promising description, which mentioned it as “delightfully sweet, full-bodied, and almost like a dessert.” However, what we received was far from that—it lacked sweetness and tasted more like plain black coffee with ice cubes, completely missing the dessert-like appeal the menu promised.nnThe French fries were average, but the cheese served alongside lacked flavor and didn’t complement the fries well. The brownie shake was another letdown—it tasted oddly like Cerelac, possibly due to the poor quality of the brownie used, which overpowered the shake’s flavor.nnOverall, the food and drinks need considerable improvement. There's a lot of scope for enhancing the taste and ensuring that menu descriptions align with what’s actually served, especially for the coffee options.
The place is really colorful and aesthetically pleasing.nThe staff are not attentive. I ordered Irish coffee and they served me Iced coffee. The masala chai is average.

One of my favourite places in town. The perfect experience for every art lover. My usual itinerary is to first spend an hour at the gallery on the ground floor before even entering the cafe. The cafe itself has a lot of artwork throughout. The plates, the chairs etc, are all pieces of art.nAmazing experience.nStaff values privacy and is not around much.nLimited menu options. But whatever they do have is good.

A nice vegetarian Cafe with beautiful art gallery in it,at Banjara Hills Road no.10,nSo visited this place @gallerycafehyd  it was a simple cafe with quite ambience as the main point of attraction was the art gallery with paintings and crafts. Coming to the food it was average as they recommended me their best seller’s , the grilled panini sandwich with cheese was good overall everything was just fine, as it was a pure vegetarian cafe vegetarians would probably like the place ✌️

Quaint place to relax.nnVery casual ambience, good food, free WiFi, lovely gallery. This is what one can feel about this place.nnAbsolutely loved the art in the gallery. You have books to read while having a good drink or snack.nnSit back relax and have good time.

There is an amazing art gallery which was nearly about 20 years old. The arts they have exhibited there are really amazing and you can buy them even. There will be some exhibitions going on every month. Other than painting, they even sell historical books, pens, bags, pillows, scarfs, mugs, coaster plates. The range of the painting start from 8K to 80K. They keep changing the painting for every week or 15 days.nThe cafe was started just 3 years ago. The taste of the food is normal. Pizzas are not at all advisable to order. The rest all are average.nFood taste is 3.5/5nAmbience is 5/5nService is 4.5/5nOverall experience is good 4/5.nPlease visit the gallery. It's amazing.

This was a random find. We went in not knowing what to expect.nnThere was easy parking, the place itself is hidden at the end of a long pathway.nnThe cafe is on the 2nd floor. You pass through a gallery on the ground and some artistic gifts on the first floor.nnThe food was really good. The staff is super helpful and their recommendations were really good. They recommended some toast with fresh avacado and a custard apple shake with zero added sugar.nnI enjoyed every bit of the food. If you happen to visit in December, you must try the shake.

Food is too delicious, especially pasta I liked it so much. You can enjoy everything here sumptuous food, different kinds of arts and all kinds of books. Must visit cafe in Hyderabad, economical pricing. Everything under one roof and peaceful place.
This cafe is one of the first places I visited when I first came to Hyderabad, so it has definitely a spcl place in my heart. And I love their food. Their ambiance is also very calm and cozy.

Its an odd place. Quite empty on a weekday afternoon but noisy -  really bad music, reminiscent of a club + the competing sound of the few other humans here watching videos on their phones. Food is baseline ok.  I am new to Hyderabad, and this will not be one of the places I return to. AND the lift is unsafe. As we went down, it stopped between floors. A staff member yelled down to us to open the collapsible door and shut it again
It is beautiful and serene the food is too good must recommended

One of the best themed cafes in Hyderabad. One can see the paintings and pictures all around the cafe which live up to it's name.nThe ambiance is good, with well disciplined workers.nThe taste of food is good, but few were just ok.nfollowing are the dish and their ratings.nnChocolate Milkshake:- 3/5nnNutella Milkshake:-4/5nnWaffle with Nutella:- 4.5/5nnWaffle with Icecream:- 3.5/5nnPaneer Tikka pizza:- 2.5/5nnWhite Sauce Spaghetti:- 4/5nnOver all the the look and feel of the cafe can be rated as 4.5/5

I have been to this place recently and have observed something which I wasn't able to witness for a long time. This cafe is located exactly on top of a Art Gallery which was closed on the day we visited and we haven't found many vehicles parked outside. I was very skeptical on the taste and visited with friends. We ordered Shakes and they didn't have the same so was disappointed and wanted to move to some other cafe. But somehow wanted to try something. We ordered Mojito, Cheese Sticks and Penne Alfredo. The taste was so good that we excused them for the shakes and wanted to order more but we were full down then.nnIn conclusion, worth the visit. Don't be disappointed if they are not having a few items from menu. Try out their Pasta for sure.

It’s a nice place for enjoying tea and coffee. Taste and presentation is good. Only reason for 3-Star ratings is untrained staff who keeps staring at the customers and second reason is mosquitoes. There was an army of mosquitoes.
Food is kind of okay but not up to the mark. Staff is so nice and friendly and environment is good 😊

#WhenAtBanjarahills and you are craving for vegetarian continental cafe then The Gallery Cafe can be one of your Saviour.nnOwing to the Name, you will see a lot of artistic crafts and scribbled paintings allover with spacious seating that can fit in 75 pax easily. Loved the smokey sambrani that's used to keep the environment relaxed.nnA pretty cool and small menu that leaves you no confusion to choose. The pricing for two would be around 500-800INR which is decent enough I think.nnWell, it's been quite a while, I had a proper Lasagna (My last and best was at The Pasta Bar Veneto which is closed now) thought I will give it a shot here and ordered #Vegetable #Lasagna. Though the taste was bang on, I would love more parmesan cheese on the top and baked. Missed that little cheesy effect. Moving on and I asked for the best pizza suggestion for which I got, #FunkieVeggieLoverPizza. Cheese and white sauce overloaded pizza that you can not see the toppings and have to call the person asking for toppings 😛 ... Again the taste and toppings were very good but this time the cheese wasn't gooey 😞 ..nnI am neither satisfied nor left sad for the fact I have used #zomatogold 😛 . Overbill I paid was only for the lasagna which is 320 including taxes.nnWell, Will, I go again? Yes for their cheesecake 😛n#annadathasukhibhavann#ClickEatXploreYo Live #CEXY

Food tastes fresh and yummy. The place is simple yet so refreshing. It has an art gallery, a book space, freshly baked goodies corner, and an art space that puts on display electic artsy stuff for the art lovers.
Amazing place to be at. Calm serene and soothing.  Food is something I have no words for. I would like people to have it instead. Go try this Cafe out it's got some nice vibe going out for it.

One of the best cafes in Hyderabad. Do try their special menu which keeps changing every couple of months. The crepe ratatouille is nice and has a ‘desi’ tinge. And probably the only vegetarian ‘cafe’ in Hyderabad. (apart from terrasen, which is vegan)
Firstly, the location was hard to find plus mediocre menu.  the place is still under renovation. The vibe is cozy but nothing stands out.

A decent and delightful place. The place as name suggests is decked with a lot of paintings and craft. It also has a small shop selling crafty accessories and stuff. The food and drinks are average. The service is friendly.

The ambience is good but we had a horrible experience because our order contained unwanted material , we ordered for garlic bread it was good and we ordered for corn and spinach sandwitch in which we found pieces of stemps , how can the chefs be soo careless what if we have eaten the stemps , the staff was very careless .

One of the best cafes in the city. The ambience is really cozy. The occasional live music goes perfectly with the vibe the place is trying to create. The food is quite delicious  to munch on. A must visit place for anyone who wants a break from their daily routine :)
